decks.notes: The deck focuses on aggressive creatures that disrupt opponents' strategies, with a mix of powerful hatebears and efficient threats. The inclusion of powerful mana acceleration in the form of Moxen and Noble Hierarch allows for quick deployment of threats. The deck also utilizes disruptive elements like Sanctum Prelate and Thalia to further disrupt opponents' game plans. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and disruptive aggro strategy while also providing some resilience against opposing strategies.

This deck focuses on quickly putting creatures into play from the graveyard or hand, taking advantage of cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Force of Vigor to fuel its aggressive strategy. By utilizing cards like Bloodghast, Vengevine, and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful board presence. Additionally, cards like Cabal Therapy and Mox Emerald provide disruption and acceleration, enabling the deck to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on using the powerful card Doomsday to set up a winning combo with Thassa's Oracle or a Lab Maniac. It includes cards to search for Doomsday, draw cards, protect the combo with counter magic, and generate mana. The goal is to quickly assemble the necessary pieces, cast Doomsday to stack the deck in your favor, and then win the game by drawing from an empty library with Thassa's Oracle or Lab Maniac. The deck is designed to be fast and efficient, aiming to win the game before the opponent can respond.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively utilize Bazaar of Baghdad to fill up the graveyard with creatures like Vengevine, Squee, Goblin Nabob, and Hollow One, as well as enabling additional synergies like casting Krovikan Horror for cheap. The deck also aims to control the game early with counterspells like Force of Will and disruptive cards like Mindbreak Trap, while having answers to opposing threats in the form of cards like Force of Vigor and Sickening Shoal. The deck can quickly apply pressure and overwhelm opponents with its high-impact threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful combo potential of Underworld Breach to cast multiple spells from the graveyard. It includes a range of efficient card draw and counterspells to protect the combo, alongside key spells like Brain Freeze and Pyroblast to secure the win condition. The mana base is constructed to support the combo pieces, with fetch lands and dual lands for consistency. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers and control spells to manipulate the game in the player's favor, while also utilizing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf to pressure opponents. The deck employs a mix of card advantage, disruption, and efficient removal to control the tempo of the game. Key cards like Force of Will and Pyroblast help protect the player's threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is carefully crafted to provide consistency and access to the necessary colors of mana. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Grave-Troll, then using cards like Bridge from Below and Ichorid to create a powerful board presence. The goal is to use graveyard recursion and sacrifice effects to overwhelm opponents with a large number of creatures, while using disruption like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will to protect the combo. The deck also includes cards like Creeping Chill for additional reach and ways to dig through the deck quickly with Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder.

The key idea of this deck is to use efficient and powerful spells, alongside disruptive elements like counterspells and hate cards, to apply constant pressure on the opponent. By combining card advantage engines like Dack Fayden and Hullbreacher with versatile threats like Young Pyromancer and Dreadhorde Arcanist, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Additionally, disruptive elements like Blood Moon and Pyroblast help to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. This aggressive strategy is further supported by mana acceleration from Moxen and efficient cantrips to maintain consistent pressure.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game by using powerful spells and cards to disrupt and control the opponent's strategy. The deck includes a variety of counterspells, card draw spells, and mana acceleration cards to outplay the opponent and stay ahead in the game. By efficiently using cards like Force of Will, Ancestral Recall, and Tinker, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and establish dominance through card advantage and strategic decision-making. With a strong mix of control and card advantage, this deck aims to dictate the pace and outcome of the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through disruption and card advantage, while utilizing Oath of Druids as a win condition. It aims to protect its key threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Narset and Oko to generate card advantage and control the board. By playing efficiently and leveraging its powerful spells, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory through the Oath of Druids combo.

The deck revolves around assembling the Dark Depths combo by sacrificing the Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It uses cards like Crop Rotation and Vampire Hexmage to expedite the process of putting both pieces on the battlefield. The deck also includes disruption in the form of cards like Chalice of the Void and Wasteland to slow down the opponent's game plan. It aims to win quickly and decisively by creating a powerful threat that can be difficult for the opponent to deal with efficiently.

The key concept of this Vintage Aggro-MUD deck is to quickly assemble a board presence of artifact creatures and utilize powerful mana acceleration to overwhelm the opponent. With cards like Steel Overseer and Walking Ballista boosting the team, alongside disruptive artifacts like Sphere of Resistance and Chalice of the Void, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while rapidly deploying threats. By using Mishra's Workshop and other mana sources efficiently, this deck can quickly establish a dominant position on the battlefield and press its advantage to secure victory.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive Eldrazi creatures while disrupting their game plan with cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Reality Smasher. The deck utilizes a combination of mana acceleration through artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen, along with land cards like Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple, to quickly deploy threats. In addition, disruptive artifacts like Null Rod and Thorn of Amethyst help slow down the opponent's plays. The deck's main strategy is to empty its hand quickly and apply pressure early in the game to close out matches swiftly.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while efficiently deploying threats of its own. Utilizing disruptive creatures like Collector Ouphe and Deathrite Shaman, along with counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm, the deck aims to control the board and protect its key threats like Tarmogoyf and Leovold. By combining card advantage engines like Narset and Hullbreacher with efficient removal spells and powerful draw spells, the deck is able to maintain a strong tempo advantage and outvalue the opponent in the long run.

This aggro MUD deck focuses on locking down the opponent's resources while utilizing powerful artifacts to ramp and disrupt their game plan. By using cards like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Karn, the Great Creator, along with mana denial cards like Sphere of Resistance and Wasteland, the deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with threats like Stonecoil Serpent and Lodestone Golem. With a combination of artifact mana acceleration and disruptive elements, this deck looks to establish an early advantage and maintain pressure throughout the game.
